title: Tyson Fury demands apology from Braun Strowman at WWE Monday Night Raw

Tyson Fury demanded an apology from Braun Strowman after being 'embarrassed' by him at WWE Smackdown last week.

Lineal world heavyweight boxing champion Fury had to be restrained by security at Smackdown after jumping the barricade following an altercation with Strowman.

The Gypsy King was ringside on Friday night when Strowman pretended to square up to him.

It appeared light-hearted at first, but then Dolph Ziggler attacked Strowman from behind and 'The Monster Among Men' sent his assailant careering into the barricade where Fury was standing, knocking the lineal world heavyweight champion back his seat.

Fury then hurdled the barricades and attempting to make a beeline for the ring but was held by security staff.

(Image: Twitter)

He appeared on WWE's Monday Night Raw, where he was asked why he was trying to provoke Strowman.

Fury replied: "I'm not trying to provoke him. He tried to make a fool out of me by throwing Dolph into me, he embarrassed me in front of my family and I want an apology."

The pair are now rumoured to be squaring off in what will be Fury's WWE debut at the establishments Crown Jewel event in Saudi Arabia on October 31.

Fury said in a video on Instagram : "Last night we attended WWE Smackdown for my son's 8th birthday. Me, as a lifelong WWE fan, and it is his favourite thing.

"I was insulted in front of my whole family by Braun Strowman. It got a little bit heated and we saw what happened.

"I have been invited to an open mic session at RAW on Monday night. I accept and I will be there.

"If Braun Strowman doesn't behave himself, he will get some of these hands, the big dosser."
description: Lineal world heavyweight boxing champion said Strowman 'tried to make a fool' out of him
